author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of various government associations blocking road near Collectorate in Salem on Monday.— Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

The police removed 650 government employees, including 250 women, when they blocked the road near Collectorate here on Monday.

The indefinite strike by members of Tamil Nadu All Department Government Employees Association entered the sixth day, affecting the functioning of various government departments and causing hardship to the public. Employees blocked the road and disrupted traffic on the bridge.

When a two-wheeler rider tried to move his vehicle in the available space on road, a protester assaulted him and used derogatory words against him. However, the motorist without preferring a police complaint left the place. Later, the police removed the protesters in vehicles. In Namakkal district, the police removed 170 men and 660 women employees after they blocked Park Road near bus stand here.

Our Special Correspondent from Erode adds: Over 2,200 striking government employees were arrested on Monday at Sampath Nagar while they were attempting to move towards the District Collectorate.

They raised slogans criticising the State Government for not holding talks to discuss their charter of demands that included restoration of old system of pension.

According to police sources, 1,791 out of 2,216 arrested members of Tamil Nadu Government Employees' Association were women. They were taken to marriage halls in police vans. All of them were released later in the day.
title: Govt. employees block road in Salem
